key.name: dbg-perspective-layout
key.summary: Layout of the perspective
key.description: The layout that is loaded by the debugging perspective

key.name: source-search-dirs
key.summary: source directory dirs
key.description: The list of directories where to search for source files. This is used only when there is not enough information in the binary to locate the file.

key.name: show-dbg-error-dialogs
key.summary: Show or don't show errors coming from the debugger engine
key.description: If set to yes, popups error message dialogs showing errors coming from the underlying debugger engine.

key.name: show-source-line-numbers
key.summary: Show or don't show source lines numbers
key.description: If set to yes, show the source code line number on the left hand side of each line.

key.name: confirm-before-reload-source
key.summary: Ask the user before reloading a source file
key.description: When a source file needs to be reloaded, if this key is set to yes, ask the user before reloading.

key.name: allow-auto-reload-source
key.summary: Do not automatically reload the source file
key.description: If the user chooses not to be asked about re-loading changed source files and if this key is set to true, re-load the source file automatically.

key.name: highlight-source-code
key.summary: Highlight source code
key.description: If set to yes, highlight source code.

key.name: use-system-font
key.summary: Whether to use the system font for the source editor
key.description: Whether to use the system font for the source editor.

key.name: custom-font-name
key.summary: The custom font to use if we're not using the system font
key.description: The custom font to use for the source editor if we're not using the system font.

key.name: use-launch-terminal
key.summary: Whether to use the terminal we were launched from
key.description: Whether to use the terminal we were launched from as the debuggee's terminal, or to use our own embedded terminal.

key.name: editor-style-scheme
key.summary: The style of the source editor
key.description: The name of the source editor color scheme.

key.name: status-widget-minimum-width
key.summary: The minimum width of the status widget
key.description: The minimum width of the status widget.

key.name: status-widget-minimum-height
key.summary: The minimum height of the status widget
key.description: The minimum height of the status widget.

key.name: default-layout-pane-location
key.summary: The location of the status pane for the default layout
key.description: The location of the status pane for the default layout

key.name: wide-layout-pane-location
key.summary: The location of the status pane for the wide layout
key.description: The location of the status pane for the wide layout

key.name: two-pane-layout-vpane-location
key.summary: The location of the vertical status pane for the two-pane layout
key.description: The location of the vertical status pane for the two-pane layout

key.name: two-pane-layout-hpane-location
key.summary: The location of the horizontal status pane for the two-pane layout
key.description: The location of the horizontalstatus pane for the two-pane layout

key.name: debugger-engine-dynmod
key.summary: The underlying debugger engine management module
key.description: The name of the debugger engine management module used.

key.name: gdb-binary
key.summary: The path to the GDB binary
key.description: The absolute path to the GDB binary, otherwise, the default makes Nemiver pick the default system GDB

key.name: asm-style-pure
key.summary: Show the assembly in pure form
key.description: If set to yes, pure assembly code is shown when switching to assembly view. Otherwise, source code mixed with assembly code is shown.

key.name: update-local-vars-at-each-stop
key.summary: Whether to update the list of local variables at each stop
key.description: Updating the list of local variables lets the debugger show variables that are created way after the beginning of the function. Disabling this option might speed up stepping but leads the debugger to miss local variables that are created after the beginning of the function.

key.name: default-num-asm-instrs
key.summary: The number of assembly instructions to show by default
key.description: The number of instructions that are disassembled by default.

key.name: context-pane-location
key.summary: The position of the splitter in the debug context tab
key.description: The position of the splitter in the debug context tab. This is saved by the UI automatically.

key.name: follow-fork-mode
key.summary: Which process to follow upon a fork
key.description: If a fork happens, follow the parent parent process if the key is set to 'parent', or follow the child process if the key is set to 'child'.

key.name: disassembly-flavor
key.summary: Which instruction set to use for the assembly
key.description: Can be either att or intel (Apply only for the x86 family CPU)

key.name: pretty-printing
key.summary: Activate GDB pretty printing
key.description: Activate the GDB pretty printing feature. Under that mode the content of many types of containers is displayed in a human friendly manner

key.name: callstack-expansion-chunk
key.summary: The size of the call stack to display
key.description: Do not automatically display call stack wider than this value.

key.name: source-file-encoding-list
key.summary: The list of of file encodings supported by nemiver
key.description: When nemiver opens a file, it assumes the encoding of the file is one of the encodings listed here. Please bear in mind that Nemiver works internally with files in the UTF-8 encoding. So when it loads a file, it must convert the file encoding into UTF-8. Therefore, Nemiver needs to know the possible set of encodings of the source files it opens.

key.name: window-width
key.summary: window width
key.description: The width of the workbench window.

key.name: window-height
key.summary: window height
key.description: The height of the workbench window.

key.name: window-position-x
key.summary: window x position
key.description: The X coordinate of the workbench window.

key.name: window-position-y
key.summary: window y position
key.description: The Y coordinate of the workbench window.

key.name: window-maximized
key.summary: window maximization
key.description: Whether the workbench window is maximized.

key.name: window-minimum-width
key.summary: window minim width
key.description: The workbench main window minium width.

key.name: window-minimum-height
key.summary: window minimum height
key.description: The workbench main window minium height.
